Elevated task scheduling software

Save time and simplify business processes with a centralized tool to streamline job scheduling across Windows and non-Windows systems.

Get a Demo

Invest in a user-friendly workspace for efficient task and project management

ActiveBatch by Redwood gives you access to advanced features for more power and flexibility than a legacy task scheduler or limited scheduling app.

Customizable integrations

Use the Service Library to create reusable job steps or apply the Super REST API Adapter to build integrations to all your core systems and apps.

Flexible job scheduling

Use a combination of granular time, date and event-based scheduling to maintain efficient workflows that require far less human intervention.

Real-time monitoring

Gain visibility into job execution and status with convenient dashboards and notifications, and proactively respond through API connections.

Event-driven architecture

Trigger jobs with the events that make the most sense for your business — emails, file transfers, message queues and more.

Windows-compatible security

ActiveBatch supports the Windows Security Model, including Kerberos and Active Directory, and its comprehensive policy framework prevents unauthorized changes.

Intelligent automation

Leverage artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) to optimize resource allocation and reduce bottlenecks.

Upgrade to true workload automation

Microsoft Windows Task Scheduler is used to create basic tasks. Much like UNIX cron or Z-Cron, Task Scheduler is a point solution designed for simplistic use cases, such as nightly batch files or time tracking for a small business. To coordinate tasks between Windows and non-Windows applications, you'll need custom PowerShell scripts or integrations.

Similarly, freeware solutions are not designed for enterprise-level scheduling and lack modern capabilities like event-driven automation.

Unlike most task management software, ActiveBatch allows you to run workloads on any operating system, including Windows 10, Mac OS, Linux, UNIX, OpenVMS and more, so you can coordinate tasks across your organization from a single control panel.

 Discover Workflow Orchestration

Look beyond due dates

Automatically trigger jobs with business or IT events to reduce delays, minimize slack time and improve SLAs. 

ActiveBatch supports various event types, including:

  • Emails
  • Execution machine reboots
  • FTP file event triggers
  • Microsoft Message Queue
  • Oracle Database triggers
  • Social media feeds
  • System startup
  • VMware events
  • Web Services
  • Windows startups
  • WMI Events

Witness the impact of workload automation

Task Scheduler jobs can be triggered by jobs from other scheduling software or task managers in non-Windows environments without any custom scripts or manual keypresses.

With ActiveBatch, you can choose from a range of scheduling options, including custom calendars, fiscal calendars, multiple time zones, custom tags and more. Engage constraint-based scheduling (CBS) to ensure new tasks don’t run until requisite conditions are met.

Expand to more use cases

An automation tool like ActiveBatch can tackle business challenges, support milestones and solve problems no traditional job scheduler can touch, like:

  • Driving effective IT change management by syncing objects across test, QA and production environments.
  • Maintaining high availability with dynamic or manual no-cluster failover to combat the threat of outages and enforce job prioritization.
  • Optimizing cloud provisioning with automation to help you achieve intelligent resource management.
  • Promoting efficiency and consistency by executing the same job or plan for different workflows using reusable job templates and variables.

Gain a tangible competitive advantage

Switching to ActiveBatch delivers priceless benefits:

  • Cross-platform integration gives you centralized automation across diverse systems for seamless workflow coordination.
  • Pre-built job steps and templates facilitate rapid development of complex automated workflows.
  • Real-time monitoring, comprehensive alert mechanisms and SLA management key features deliver operational efficiency far beyond what a simple job scheduler can provide.
  • Non-cluster failover supports high availability to ensure continuous operation and minimal downtime.

Flexible options for seamless integration

ActiveBatch's Integrated Jobs Library provides pre-built, universal connectors. With dozens of extensions for popular applications like SAP and Informatica, your team members can easily automate and execute task runs from a central coordination point.

Integrate automated tasks from virtually any application or system using the low-code REST API and create drag-and-drop objects to reuse.

This extensibility facilitates the rapid creation of scheduled tasks and subtasks and the development of reliable, end-to-end workflows.

Task scheduling software FAQs

What is workload automation?

Workload automation (WLA) is the practice of using software to streamline, schedule and manage complex processes, applications and tasks across an organization\'s IT ecosystem. It enables users to automate manual, repetitive processes and ensures that interdependent workflows are executed efficiently and consistently, reducing the need for manual human intervention.

WLA platforms with intuitive user interfaces allow for no-code/low-code workflow development for DevOps, data management and much more.

Discover the capabilities workload automation products offer for IT automation, ETL and more.
What is the difference between job scheduling and workload automation?

Job scheduling and workload automation solutions were designed for different goals, but they\'re closely related and share some functionality. Job scheduling tools focus on individual tasks or “jobs” at a specific time or in a defined sequence. These jobs are often standalone and have minimal dependencies. They are often triggered by time-based schedules.

Workload automation (WLA) goes beyond individual jobs to orchestrate interconnected workflows that span multiple systems or applications. WLA handles complex, event-driven workflows that adapt based on real-time conditions, such as new emails or Google Calendar events. WLA software features dashboards that allow users to track progress for multiple jobs and workflows from a single point of control.

Learn more about how job scheduling and workload automation are revolutionizing the modern workplace.
